name: Xinda Wang 0001
content: Xinda WangSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationXinda Wang (王新达)Assistant ProfessorDepartment of Computer ScienceThe University of Texas at DallasEmail: xinda [dot] wang [at] utdallas [dot] eduOffice: ECSS 4.705Google Scholar, LinkedInI am currently a tenure-track assistant professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Texas at Dallas. I received my Ph.D. degree from George Mason University in 2023, advised by Dr. Kun Sun at the Center of Secure Information System and honored with Outstanding Dissertation Award. My research interest is software security, with a focus on applying machine/deep learning for vulnerability detection, patch management, program analysis, etc. I am also interested in AI security and systems security. News[09/2025] Two papers titled "MAVUL: Multi-Agent Vulnerability Detection via Contextual Reasoning and Interactive Refinement" and "NatGVD: Natural Adversarial Example Attack towards Graph-based Vulnerability Detection" accepted by TPS 2025. Congrats to Youpeng, Avilash, and Weiliang![09/2025] Invited to serve in the TPC for CCS 2026.[09/2025] Our vulnerability and patch datasets (D0V, PatchDB) are selected by Google DeepMind to evaluate Gemini 1.5 and by NSF as 1 of 10 datasets for integration into NAIRR Pilot to power AI literacy, education, and innovation. [08/2025] One paper "VPGFUZZ: Vulnerable Path-Guided Greybox Fuzzing" accepted by TIFS.[07/2025] Our proposal on "An Infrastructure and Dataset for Research in Software Vulnerability Detection and Remediation" is funded by NSF CIRC Planning-C Program (Lead PI). Thanks NSF![04/2025] Led a group of 11 female students and faculty members to the Women in Cybersecurity (WiCyS) conference. Thanks UTD CS's support as Platinum Sponsor for WiCyS 2025! [04/2025] One paper "An Empirical Study of Multi-Language Security Patches in Open Source Software" accepted by DIMVA 2025.[04/2025] Invited to serve in the TPC for Usenix Security 2026 and DSN 2026.[01/2025] One paper "DISPATCH: Unraveling Security Patches from Entangled Code Changes" accepted by USENIX Security 2025.[10/2024] One paper "FedCAP: Robust Federated Learning via Customized Aggregation and Personalization" accepted by ACSAC 2024.  Congrats Youpeng on receiving the ACSAC 2024 Student Conferenceship to present our work in Hawaii![09/2024] One paper "Enhancing Pre-Trained Language Models for Vulnerability Detection via Semantic-Preserving Data Augmentation" accepted by SecureComm 2024. Congrats to Weiliang![04/2024] One paper "Bridging the Gap: A Study of AI-based Vulnerability Management between Industry and Academia", in collaboration with Meta security researchers, accepted by DSN 2024 Industry Track.[11/2023] Our paper "BinGo: Identifying Security Patches in Binary Code with Graph Representation Learning" accepted by AsiaCCS 2024.[08/2023] Received Grace Hopper Celebration of Women in Computing (GHC) 2023 Faculty Scholarship.Publications(Underlined: PhD students at UTD. **co-first author)DISPATCH: Unraveling Security Patches from Entangled Code Changes.
